H0.text: Moving water is considered a nonrenewable energy source.

H1.text: Fossil fuel is an energy source considered nonrenewable.

H2.text: Wind is considered a nonrenewable energy source.

H3.text: Biomass is the energy source considered nonrenewable.

A4.text: Although fossil fuels are continually formed by natural processes, they are classified as non-renewable resources because they take millions of years to form and known viable reserves are being depleted much faster than new ones are generated.
